newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Cricket-World cup champs Sri Lanka seek new coach.
newsitem.headline: Cricket-World cup champs Sri Lanka seek new coach.

text.p: World Cup holders Sri Lanka are to advertise for a coach to replace former Australian test player Dav Whatmore who is quitting to join English county side Lancashire when his contract expires in May next year.
"We will advertise locally and internationally for someone to coach the World Cup champions," Upali Dharmadasa, president of Sri Lanka's cricket board, said on Wednesday.
Dharmadasa said the board had not anticipated the highly respected Whatmore "leaving at this stage".
He emphasised that there had been no ill-feeling between Whatmore and the board.
Whatmore took on his coaching role in Sri Lanka in June 1995 after the board failed in their bid to enlist two former test captains, Allan Border and Ian Botham.
